summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel providing additional discovery materials under a protective order in the case United States v. Michael Thomas. The document outlines Bates number ranges for confidential and attorney's eyes only materials being produced.

persons.name: Montell Figgins
persons.context: Attorney representing the defendant Michael Thomas, receiving discovery materials from the U.S. Attorney's Office.

persons.name: Michael Thomas
persons.context: Defendant in criminal case No. 19 Cr. 830, referenced in the case title United States v. Michael Thomas.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, signing off on the discovery letter.

connections.description: Figgins is the defense attorney representing Thomas in the criminal case.
Strauss, as Acting U.S. Attorney, is prosecuting the case against Thomas.

events.title: Protective Order Entered
events.description: A protective order was entered in the case United States v. Michael Thomas, governing the disclosure of discovery materials.

events.title: Discovery Production Letter
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sent a letter to defense counsel providing additional discovery materials under Rule 16(a).

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Law Offices of Montell Figgins, 17 Academy Street, Suite 305, Newark, NJ 07102
keyFacts: The document is a discovery letter in the criminal case United States v. Michael Thomas (No. 19 Cr. 830).
Discovery materials are being produced under a protective order entered on December 16, 2019, with specific Bates number ranges designated as confidential or attorney's eyes only.
Some materials (SDNY_MT_00000177 through SDNY_MT_00000210) are being produced only to the defendant, Michael Thomas, not just his attorney.
The letter is signed by Audrey Strauss, the Acting United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, on October 14, 2020.
